Name: Le Chic Resto Pop
Brief description: The organization offers, through its socially responsible restaurant, nutritious, quality meals at low prices to meet the needs of people experiencing food insecurity. It is also a welcoming living environment, open to all, which promotes social diversity

Name: Maison de Quartier Villeray
Brief description: Since 1989, It offers activities stimulating mutual aid and solidarity between its participants. Its goal is to support individuals while offering a collective environment that contributes to improving life conditions of citizens.

Name: Resto Plateau
Brief description: Non-profit organization with the goal of increasing autonomy, inclusion, and access to resources by providing essential needs such as food security for Montréal community and its surrounding.

Name: MADA Community Center
Brief description: Volunteer-based organization that evolved from a small neighbourhood centre to Montreal’s central address for fighting poverty in our community

Name: Mile End Mission
Available Roles: Food preparation, Cooking, Packing & Sorting, Warehouse
Brief description: Volunteer-run, not-for-profit organization and community centre working with members of the community who have been marginalized by society for a variety of reasons.

Name: Sun Youth Organization
Brief description: We have been taking care of people for more than 65 years by providing individuals and families in need, a wide range of emergency services that ensure their basic needs are covered and maintain their integrity.

Name: Cuisine et Vie Collective St Roch
Brief description: Non-profit organization that aims to give a better life quality and support for people and families of the Parc-Extension neighbourhood.

Name: Partageons L'espoir
Brief description: Our mission is to awaken hopes and dreams in the community through programs that fosters the overall development and success of youth, increases access to food security and health for all and offers work training programs.

Name: West Island Mission
Brief description: West Island Mission is a non-profit organization that provides well-balanced, high quality food assistance and other related aid to the less fortunate living in the West Island of Montreal. We offer three programs: monthly food assistance, Christmas food baskets and back-to-school support.

Name: Centre de Ressource et D'action Communautaire Petite Patrie
Brief description: Non-profit organization that fight against poverty. Through activities in food security and and against waste, it improves life conditions of its members and defend their fundamental rights.

Name: Le PAS de la Rue
Available Roles: Administration, Cooking, Food preparation, Cleaning, Daycare
Brief description: Le PAS de la rue is a non-profit that, for more than twenty years, helps, accompanies and supports people 55 and older who are homeless, in severe economic precariousness or in social isolation.

Name: Robins des Bois
Available Roles: Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation, Food serving
Brief description: Robin des Bois is a non-profit restaurant. Our mission is to overcome loneliness, social isolation and poverty.

Name: Moisson Rive Sud
Brief description: Main food bank of the south shore of Montreal. Covering more than 70% of the territory, it collects nearly 3.3 million Kg of food from companies and redistributes it free of charge to more than 100 organizations working with the vulnerable population.

Name: Chez Doris
Available Roles: Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation, Food serving, Daycare, Delivery, Packing & Sorting
Brief description: Chez Doris is a women’s shelter with the mandate to help any women in a position of difficulty.

Name: Meals For Milton-Parc
Available Roles: Cooking, Food preparation, Food serving, Delivery
Brief description: Meals For Milton-Parc (M4MP) is a community-based project supporting the individuals without houses in the Milton-Parc neighborhood.

Name: The Yellow Door
Brief description: Empower older adults and young people to initiate and engage in community and creative projects that promote social inclusion, combat urban isolation across all generations, and spark positive societal change.

Name: Santropol Roulant
Available Roles: Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation, Delivery, Packing & Sorting
Brief description: Intergenerational community food hub where we grow, prepare and deliver food. We create a continuum of engaging services that help build a stronger social fabric, and increase food security and social inclusion for Montrealers.

Name: APRMM
Available Roles: Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation, Delivery, Packing & Sorting
Brief description: Since 1986, the Association des popotes roulantes du Montréal Métropolitain (APRMM) has been coordinating a network of entirely volunteer run popotes.

Name: Dans La Rue
Available Roles: Education, Daycare, Packing & Sorting, Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation
Brief description: Focused on helping homeless and at-risk youth.  Dans la rue cares for their immediate needs and helps them acquire the skills and ressources needed to lead more autonomous and rewarding lives.

Name: Midnight Kitchen
Available Roles: Delivery, Gardening, Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation
Brief description: Midnight Kitchen is a non-profit, worker and volunteer-run collective that operates out of tio’tia:ke (unceded kanien’kehá:ka territory) dedicated to providing accessible food to as many people as possible.

Name: Saint House
Available Roles: Education, Daycare, Delivery, Cleaning, Cooking, Food preparation
Brief description: Saint Columba is engaged in seeking justice through empowerment, education and social action, as a community ministry of the United Church of Canada in partnership with the Point Saint Charles Community.
